metadata.title: CVE-2014-8651 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The KDE Clock KCM policykit helper in kde-workspace before 4.11.14 andplasma-desktop before 5.1.1 allows local users to gain privileges via acrafted ntpUtility (ntp utility name) argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freespacenotifier - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-style-oxygen - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-window-manager - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-window-manager-active - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-window-manager-common - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace-bin - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace-data - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace-data-extras - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace-kgreet-plugins - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2
kde-workspace-randr - 4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2

criterions.comment: kde-workspace package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.11.11-0ubuntu0.2').
